text: I
oh this is Bill Cunningham from Fifth
Avenue to the west of Greenwich Village
to Coney Island and this week is a
reflection of the nineteen thirty forty
painter reginal mush American Pater and
he has just had a retrospective at the
New York Historical Society it closes
the end of this week the reason for all
of this is that every summer I look
around in photograph street fairs
parades people in the village uptown
Coney Island and I'm always reminded of
Reginald Marsh paintings and I've always
thought what perfect subjects people are
today and original Marsh was alive he
passed away in 1954 he I think would
have been painting these particular
subjects he specialized on working class
he had nothing to do with highfalutin
snobs he liked it really raw energy and
I thought this is what you see if you go
move around New York it's not uncommon
and all of the people seem here
reflected that to me and so it's really
just a collage of what I think would
have interested him it interested me and
particularly interested with all of the
cutout t-shirts oversized loads into the
fringe now that's a fashion from what 15
years ago 20 years ago the hippies and
it continues on now and it's wonderful
it carries on people do it themselves
but any rate it's just another facet of
that marvelous American life that
encompasses everyone and everything and
whether you like it or not it's there
and they have the freedom to express
themselves
you
